item.title: Syipkpker
item.dc:creator: @waffle1 waffle`
item.description:
@waffle1 wrote:

Remove the thread perclient and set it to allow only one connection per client.

Not helping you? Okay, okay, let me spoon feed you :).

Go here to remove thread per client.

You can go here to set one connection per client.

Not to sound like a dick, but all I did was type “syi” into the search bar and read for about 2 minutes.
Search bar is an amazing thing :). Hope these tuts help you.

No credit for tuts, btw.

Read full topic

item.title: Syipkpker
item.dc:creator: @I_D_D_S_I I D D S I
item.description:
@I_D_D_S_I wrote:

[quote=“MANIHATEYOU, post:10, topic:268038”]so it starts with this -------> public void run()

and ends up like this |
/

public void run(for(int i = 0; i < server.playerHandler.players.length; i++){
Player p = server.playerHandler.players[i]; if(p != null &&
!p.disconnected && p.connectedFrom.equals(connectedFrom) &&
playerId != p.playerId && !connectedFrom.equals(“localhost”)){
returnCode = 9; disconnected =
true; return; } } )[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 17, 2009, 01:53:06 pm[/size][hr]and very sory i dont know ho to put in that gray box sorry[/quote]

use [ code]text[ /code] but then without space.
It shall look like this: [code]
public void run() {
for(int i = 0; i < server.playerHandler.players.length; i++){
Player p = server.playerHandler.players[i]; if(p != null &&
!p.disconnected && p.connectedFrom.equals(connectedFrom) &&
playerId != p.playerId && !connectedFrom.equals(“localhost”)){
returnCode = 9; disconnected =
true; return; } }

**other stuff **
[/code]

item.title: Syipkpker
item.dc:creator: @I_D_D_S_I I D D S I
item.description:
@I_D_D_S_I wrote:

[quote=“jc22493, post:7, topic:268038”][quote author=I D D S I link=topic=353813.msg2710965#msg2710965 date=1237315619]
first dont post your ip adress here.
here, easy 1 but working

Within public void run() add this

for(int i = 0; i < server.playerHandler.players.length; i++){ Player p = server.playerHandler.players[i]; if(p != null && !p.disconnected && p.connectedFrom.equals(connectedFrom) && playerId != p.playerId && !connectedFrom.equals("localhost")){ returnCode = 9; disconnected = true; return; } }

creds 0% me, 100% xx k03d xx1
[/quote]
I don’t think that’s enough to allow only one connection per IP, but I may be wrong.[/quote]

well, it works fine for me

MANIHATEYOU dont forget to put a } at end or something

Read full topic
